title: WARN Duplicate AssetLoader preregistered for Asset type `bevy_image::image::Image` with extensions `["hdr"]`. when run breakout example

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: C-Examples
labels.description: An addition or correction to our examples

labels.name: S-Needs-Investigation
labels.description: This issue requires detective work to figure out what's going wrong

labels.name: D-Straightforward
labels.description: Simple bug fixes and API improvements, docs, test and examples

body:
## Bevy version

The release number or commit hash of the version you're using.

```
git log -1
commit 4bf647ff3b0ca7c8ca47496db9cfe03702328473 (HEAD -> main, origin/main, origin/HEAD)
```

## \[Optional\] Relevant system information

If you cannot get Bevy to build or run on your machine, please include:

- the Rust version you're using (you can get this by running `cargo --version`)
```
cargo --version
cargo 1.81.0 (2dbb1af80 2024-08-20)
```
  - Bevy relies on the "latest stable release" of Rust
  - nightly should generally work, but there are sometimes regressions: please let us know!
- the operating system or browser used, including its version
  - Windows 11 23H2

If your bug is rendering-related, copy the adapter info that appears when you run Bevy.

```ignore
`INFO bevy_render::renderer: AdapterInfo { name: "NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4050 Laptop GPU", vendor: 4318, device: 10465, device_type: DiscreteGpu, driver: "NVIDIA", driver_info: "560.94", backend: Vulkan }`
```

You should also consider testing the examples of our upstream dependencies to help isolate any setup-specific issue:

- [`wgpu`](https://github.com/gfx-rs/wgpu) for rendering problems
- [`winit`](https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit) for input and window management
- [`gilrs`](https://docs.rs/gilrs/latest/gilrs/) for gamepad inputs

## What you did
 ` cargo run --example breakout`

## What went wrong

If it's not clear, break this out into:

- what were you expecting?
- Run successfully
- what actually happened?

```
cargo run --example breakout
...
    Finished `dev` profile [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 51.48s
     Running `target\debug\examples\breakout.exe`
2024-10-08T07:58:04.636297Z  INFO bevy_diagnostic::system_information_diagnostics_plugin::internal: SystemInfo { os: "Windows 11 Home China", kernel: "22631", cpu: "Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-14650HX", core_count: "16", memory: "15.7 GiB" }
2024-10-08T07:58:05.580350Z  INFO bevy_render::renderer: AdapterInfo { name: "NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4050 Laptop GPU", vendor: 4318, device: 10465, device_type: DiscreteGpu, driver: "NVIDIA", driver_info: "560.94", backend: Vulkan }
2024-10-08T07:58:05.701200Z  WARN bevy_asset::server::loaders: Duplicate AssetLoader preregistered for Asset type `bevy_image::image::Image` with extensions `["hdr"]`. Loader must be specified in a .meta file in order to load assets of this type with these extensions.
2024-10-08T07:58:06.496605Z  INFO bevy_winit::system: Creating new window "App" (0v1#4294967296)
2024-10-08T07:58:06.585224Z  INFO breakout::stepping: Bevy was compiled without stepping support. Run with `--features=bevy_debug_stepping` to enable stepping.
2024-10-08T07:58:07.158131Z  WARN bevy_ecs::system::function_system: bevy_pbr::render::mesh_view_bindings::prepare_mesh_view_bind_groups did not run because it requested inaccessible system parameter Res<OitBuffers>
2024-10-08T07:58:11.091470Z  INFO bevy_window::system: No windows are open, exiting
2024-10-08T07:58:11.094472Z  INFO bevy_winit::system: Closing window 0v1#4294967296
2024-10-08T07:58:11.124012Z  INFO bevy_window::system: No windows are open, exiting
```

## Additional information

Other information that can be used to further reproduce or isolate the problem.
This commonly includes:

- screenshots
- logs
- theories about what might be going wrong
- workarounds that you used
- links to related bugs, PRs or discussions
